rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Brilliant professor. Great class. If you like thinking deep about political economy, marx, telecommuncation, internet etc, I recommend this class. But if you are not interested in the class topics, not read the class materials and don't engage in the class discussion; it may be a very difficult class.

Honestly one of the best professors I've ever taken a class from. His classes were so interesting that I emailed him before my last semester to see what courses he was teaching so that I could take another one with him. The Ted Mosby of UNC

The lecture consisted of Dr. Palm pacing in front of the class, asking rhetorical questions that he never answered and that didn't matter. Three papers, but absolutely no guidelines. Not even a topic. Even made five pages very difficult. The screenings were kind of interesting, but overall I left still wondering what the purpose of the class was.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Grossberg is brilliant and passionate about his politics.  He is what a professor should be.  The course will give a framework for you life if you work at it.

Larry Grossberg is clearly brilliant and passionate about his subject.    In spite of being a world-famous scholar, he is approachable and student-friendly.  But to echo others:  this class will take more than all of your time and the materials will cost you big bucks. Regardless, it is a fabulous class. Plus, he's kinda hot in a geeky sort of way

Larry is a true intellectual, and this class is worth taking. However be warned: this is not an introductory class, there is A LOT to read and make sure you know something about the sources of Cultural studies (Marxism, Gramsci, BCCS). Don't do that and you'll find yourself scratching your head so many times that you will bleed to death.

Larry is brilliant. The material is incredibly complex and his expectations are high, but it can be one of the most intellectually rewarding classes you will ever take if you make the committment to it.
No Comments

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: one of the most amazing people i've ever met.  i learned a lot about course materials, and i learned a lot about how i want to be in the world.  difficult work made so enjoyable by a talented and committed professor.
Amazing teacher, interesting class.  You get to know your peers very well, and every class was interesting.  She's brilliant.
If you like tear-jerker Lifetime movies, this is the class for you.  If you don't like to tell private secrets for a grade, stay away.

An interesting class and an interesting teacher. If you can examine the emotion of a piece of literature and look at it in an unexpected way (some bullsh*t is extremely helpful) than you'll have a good time. Not difficult grade-wise and lots of fun if you buy into the concept of performance lit.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Dempsey is probably the most nurturing and kind professor I have encountered at Carolina! The class is extremely engaging, but beware, there is plenty of work that will catch up with you at the end of class. Start the assignments early on and it will be smooth sailing from there.

If you have the opportunity to take a class with Prof. Dempsey you should! She is extremely dedicated to teaching, as well as staying current within her field. Her classes are extremely interactive and you will not regret enrolling in any of her courses!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Balthrop is an extremely unique person. He is very friendly and new everyone's name in the class in 3 days. He is willing to help and explain concepts if you take the initiative. There is a lot of reading, which I didn't do... When he gives an essay make sure you ask him exactly what he wants!!! very unclear about essays.

Great class. I liked his laid back lecturing style. Even though the class was fairly large, he was very good a encouraging discussion. Exams are fairly easy. However, you have to write two long papers, and the TAs are tough graders.
Loved professor Balthrop - One of the best professors I have had thus far at UNC, definitely worth taking this class. Laid back and discussion based.

i loved dr. balthrop! i can't believe the people below complained about him! he's extremely well informed on the subject and class is more about discussion than grades. he is so laid back and very approachable. i wish i could take another class with him!
interesting class, great teacher. very laid back guy, just wants his students to learn something not focused on tests and grades.

Dr. Balthrop is great! The class was a freshman seminar about Ireland. Very interesting and he is very informed on the subject. He's a fair grader and funny guy. He's more interested in students learning rather than getting perfect test scores. One of my favorite classes and professors.

one of my favorite professors...it's obvious that he loves what he teaches.  also not a tough grader-- i missed quite a bit of class and managed a b.  a friendly guy who remembers his students and genuinely cares.
One of the worst professors you could ever hope to meet.  He pretends to be open minded about social issues but refuses to listen to anyone's opinion in class.  Avoid at all costs.
Phenomenal teacher, very interesting and fun.  Best I have had in college
He can't teach worth %$@#, one of the worst teachers and classes that I have ever had including high school.
This is by far the worst class I have taken here.  I am a junior currently.  The course title is Rhetoric and Social Controversy

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Doesn't show up to class half the time and when he does his lectures are convoluted and non-directional. When it came time for the exam, we were given our reading syllabus as a study guide. Probably the most maddening class I've taken at Carolina. Avoid.

Horrible class. Dr. Watts cancelled class over 10 times, which is completely unacceptable. Lectures complicated and doesn't discuss many questions that you find in the tests.  If you're a COMM major, take it with someone else. Probably one of the worst I've had at UNC.

Dr. Watts is a very good professor if you're willing to participate in class. He cancels class at least once every two weeks. I didn't do readings AT ALL and I made a B+ on the first exam. He's very fun and one of my favorites by far.

THIS IS A HORRIBLE PROFESSOR! There are not enough characters unfortunately, but basically he doesn't show up to class, and when he does, he makes easy material convoluted and unnecessarily complicated. I am an Honors student and expected an easy A- had to drop the course bc our "study guide" for the one midterm was our readings syllabus. AVOID!!
Eric is very enthusiastic about teaching. His lectures are interesting and he likes student involvement. Eric's class was one of my favorites taken at UNC.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Cante is not a professor for you if you are a typical millennial college student and want your hand held. His lectures take you to a new dimension of engagement with the material that if you give it an honest effort it begins to take shape and become clear. This class is an easy A if you write down profound things he says and apply it to material.
Fascinating material.
One of the best professors at Carolina.

Rich Cante is a BRILLIANT Professor!  And, yes, he can read notes on a napkin and still provide you with the theoretical base that you need in the academy and beyond.  If you are a REAL intellectual you will love, respect and appreciate Cante!

Utterly terrible.  It's frustrating that he is obviously brilliant, yet he doesn't structure any of his lectures.  He rants and raves and takes joy in leaving his class a confused mess.  Worst teacher at Chapel Hill.
Really boring, doesn't make sense, and won't take questions in class
No Comments
just talk to him.  can seem intimidting in class, but is a really nice guy who cres greatly about his students.
Loved the class.  Which he had more personality and was less obtrusive and monotone.  Overall learned a lot.
No Comments
No Comments
Rich rules and he is hilarious.  One of the few profs who tells it like it is.  He is brilliant.
Demanding, but interesting, clear and funny (in a dry sort of way).  Doesn't hurt that he's very cute!

Excellent.  He's very excited by ideas and very original.  Just make sure you keep up with the reading, or you will be *****d.  Also, if you do badly on the midterm just really improve a lot on the final paper and he'll give you a high class grade anyway.
Cante is by far the best prof in Comm. He's hard but totally fair and cool.
No Comments
Cante MEANS BUSINESS.  But he also has a real sense of humor.  Great prof for serious students looking for offbeat classes.
